page.title: 08Religon (continued)
page.content: serving vicar was probably Rev.Homan-Berry who was vicar for 23 years. The Church is built of red bricks in the old English style and consists of a single aisle,a Chancel,sanctuaries and vestries. The Parish Church of St. Mary's , Dudleston is set on a elevated site in the middle of the village .It is of Norman origin, but has seen extensive alterations in Victorian times, including new side aisles,new chancel and tower. Points of interest are the fine hammer-beam roof, the Saxon preaching cross in the churchyard and the heavily carved Jacobean pulpit. The parish is now joined with Criftins and Dudleston Heath and shares the incumbent. The Methodists are served by the {Main Road Chapel}and{Chapel Lane.}
